intro: Neolloydia gielsdorfiana, commonly known as the Gielsdorf's neolloydia, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions in Central America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in complex, branched clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
